glg2d

Class G2DGLImageDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • glg2d.G2DGLImageDrawer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    G2DDrawingHelper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    G2DShaderImageDrawer

    public class G2DGLImageDrawer
extends Object
implements G2DDrawingHelper
    Draws images for the GLGraphics2D class.

    • Field Detail

      • cache

        protected G2DGLImageDrawer.TextureCache cache
        This cache is kept for each paint operation. We don't keep track of images being changed across different painting calls. The first time we see an image, we cache the texture. Then we clear the cache for the next call to display().

      • g2d

        protected GLGraphics2D g2d

        public void setG2D(GLGraphics2D g2d)
        Description copied from interface: G2DDrawingHelper
        Sets the current GLGraphics2D parent. The current GL and GLContext objects can be accessed from this.
        Specified by:
        setG2D in interface G2DDrawingHelper
        Parameters:
        g2d - The parent context for subsequent drawing operations.

      • push

        public void push(GLGraphics2D newG2d)
        Description copied from interface: G2DDrawingHelper
        Sets the new GLGraphics2D context in a stack. This is called when Graphics2D.create() is called and each helper is given notice to push any necessary information onto the stack. This is used in conjunction with G2DDrawingHelper.pop(GLGraphics2D).
        Specified by:
        push in interface G2DDrawingHelper
        Parameters:
        newG2d - The new context, top of the stack.

      • pop

        public void pop(GLGraphics2D parentG2d)
        Description copied from interface: G2DDrawingHelper
        Sets the new GLGraphics2D context in a stack after a pop. This is called when Graphics2D.dispose() is called and each helper is given notice to pop any necessary information off the stack. This is used in conjunction with G2DDrawingHelper.push(GLGraphics2D).
        Specified by:
        pop in interface G2DDrawingHelper

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: G2DDrawingHelper
        Disposes the helper object. This is not called during the dispose operation of the Graphics2D object. This should dispose all GL resources when all drawing is finished and no more calls will be executing on this OpenGL context and these resources.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface G2DDrawingHelper

      • getTexture

        protected Texture getTexture(Image image,
                 ImageObserver observer)
        Cache the texture if possible. I have a feeling this will run into issues later as images change. Just not sure how to handle it if they do. I suspect I should be using the ImageConsumer class and dumping pixels to the screen as I receive them.

        If an image is a BufferedImage, turn it into a texture and cache it. If it's not, draw it to a BufferedImage and see if all the image data is available. If it is, cache it. If it's not, don't cache it. But if not all the image data is available, we will draw it what we have, since we draw anything in the image to a BufferedImage.

      • toBufferedImage

        protected BufferedImage toBufferedImage(Image image)
